Legal_Issue: Whether the Pension Appeal Board applied the correct legal test for granting leave to appeal
Burden_of_Proof: Minister required to 'establish' error, contrary to 'arguable case' standard
Legal_Rule: PAB must determine if there is an arguable ground for appeal, not whether the applicant will succeed
Procedural_Issue: PAB applied a higher standard than required by law
Grounds_for_Claim: Arguable ground for appeal based on interpretation of common-law relationship
Review_Standard: Correctness regarding legal test, reasonableness otherwise
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: PAB's application of wrong test rendered process unfair
Legal_Framework: Pension benefits legislation and administrative law principles
Applicant_Challenge: Minister challenged PABâ€™s denial of leave to appeal
Court_Result: Remanded for reconsideration under correct legal standard
Legal_Rule_Source: Established case law on administrative decision-making
Standard_of_Proof: Arguable case, not 'reasonable chance of success'
Remedy_Requested: Leave to appeal denied; remedy sought was reconsideration
Outcome: PAB decision set aside, case remanded
Remedy_Sought: Reconsideration by PAB under correct legal test
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: No arguable case found due to incorrect standard
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application for leave to appeal pending
Governing_Rule: Test for leave to appeal in administrative decisions
